title: GrumisNaru
author: GrumisNaru
content: OrangeWebsite.com is the biggest scam I have ever seen on the web hosting industry.They call themselves: OrangeWebsite: Icelandic Web Hosting with Free Speech, this can only be a joke. Don’t fall for their trick of accepting bitcoin, they are trash and a scam.If they don’t like you for whatever reason, they will confiscate your balance and literally steal your domains! That’s right, never seen before. Just read their TOS they literally write there that they can confiscate your money and domains FOR WHATEVER REASON AND WITHOUT NOTICE!This is totally unbelievable. Also they seem to be buying TrustPilot reviews, I was reading their positive feedback and looks like all fake, the only real like comments are actually the negative ones. What a joke.OrangeWebsite.com is a total scam! Stay away!

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I never heard of this hosting site before but after a bit search, it seems some users mention it here on the forum.I don't know if they are scams or not but no one yet reports it that they are scam.If you don't have a website hosted on their platform how can you tell that their service is a scam?You must provide some evidence here to prove that they are scammers if you can't then we can't say that this hosting provider is a scam.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: So how are we going to judge if orangewebsite.com is a scam or not without any proof to show how you were scammed.You might want to move this post to Scam accusations board and use a better scam report format like this oneCode:[b][color=black]What happened: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Scammers Profile Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Reference Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Amount Scammed: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Payment Method: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Proof of Payment: [/color][/b][b][color=black]PM/Chat Logs: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Additional Notes: [/color][/b]

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: If you don't mind, you can mention your domain name here. They do prohibit some types of site content that are considered to violate Icelandic law, just see if your site is safe from this category. https://orangewebsite.com/docs/tos.phpThat includes old web hostingers who still accept bitcoin consistently.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: It's the first time I've heard of this company, but so far what seems to be happening is, at worst, optional fraud, and therefore without proven cases, we cannot say that they are frauds.Quote from: GrumisNaru on April 18, 2023, 11:29:26 PMThis is totally unbelievable. Also they seem to be buying TrustPilot reviews, I was reading their positive feedback and looks like all fake, the only real like comments are actually the negative ones. What a joke.This is suspicious activity in the future. If any site has zero negative evaluations, this is a sign of avoidance, and negative evaluations are the only indicator of the classification of sites.Overall, thank you for the warning, and if there is any evidence of scam, please attach it.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: GrumisNaru on April 18, 2023, 11:29:26 PMIf they don’t like you for whatever reason, they will confiscate your balance and literally steal your domains! very important lesson. Never, never use the same registry for both hosting and domain. It should always be with two different companies. In case of any migration or change of provider, in such cases, things can get complicated very easily. Especially when we are talking about such small and relatively unknown services.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: So have you been tricked into hosting on their platform so you can't use it or have your balance on hold for no apparent reason?How do you conclude that the platform is a scam when there is no strong evidence to see the truth, to be honest I just heard of this platform that can pay with bitcoins but I see no concrete accusations with this site.You can continue this discussion by providing some evidence.
